intro: Coryphantha maliterrarum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved coryphantha, is a species of flowering plant in the cacti family, Cactaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features a short, cylindrical stem with prominent areoles, from which it produces clusters of bright yellow flowers. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it has a shallow root system adapted to conserve water. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in desert gardens.
